summary: Mary Elizabeth Ponder was a staff member of the U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA). Her name appears on multiple payroll certification reports from February 1977 to December 1977, indicating she was employed by the committee during that period. The documents list her name, social security number, and salary, confirming her role as a paid staff member. The specific nature of her duties is not detailed in these payroll documents.
key_connections: U.S. House of Representatives Select Committee on Assassinations (HSCA)
significance: Mary Elizabeth Ponder's significance lies in her employment with the HSCA, the committee tasked with investigating the assassination of JFK. While the payroll certifications do not specify her role, her employment indicates she contributed to the committee's work during its investigation.
